articles.title: Catherine Garcia, PhD
articles.contents:
Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
          About
          Research
          Teaching
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
            
              Taiguey (Good day in the Taino language)! I am an assistant professor of sociology and a core faculty member of the Minority Health Disparities Initiative at the University of Nebraska - Lincoln. As a gerontologist, I apply a combined intersectionality and life-course perspective to contextualize what mechanisms account for the heterogeneity in health and mortality outcomes among older Latina/o/x subgroups. My research is inherently interdisciplinary and is grounded in sociology, biology, psychology, and policy.

My research is inherently interdisciplinary and is grounded in sociology, biology, psychology, and policy.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
          About
          Research
          Teaching
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Research
          
          
            
              I am a Gerontologist that studies Latina/o/x aging and health. The primary objective of my research is to inform efforts aimed at reducing race/ethnic health inequalities that characterize our growing older adult population. Specifically, I am interested in identifying how residential environments and sociocultural processes “get under the skin” to influence health by elucidating the complex association between neighborhood conditions, sociocultural factors, psychosocial factors, and physiological precursors to disease and functional health decline among Latina/o/xs.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
Catherine Garcia, PhD
          
          
          About
          Research
          Teaching
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Teaching
          
          
            
              My teaching background has largely centered on teaching quantitative methods in the social sciences and my overarching goal is to give students the tools to understand the world they live in by teaching them sociological and gerontological approaches to formulating research questions and research designs that can answer those questions.
